results.title: Carousel
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Henry Ephron and Henry King
results.brief_description: Gordon MacRae and Shirley Jones star in this musical fantasy about the miraculous powers of love. Filmed on location with beautiful seaside settings as a backdrop and a thrilling score for accompaniment, their romance unfolds. Gordon MacRae is Billy, a carnival worker who falls in love with Shirley Jones. Before the birth of their daughter, Billy is killed. Now years later, he returns to earth for one day to teach his daughter one very important lesson. A poetic and lyrical Rodgers and Hammerstein musical based on Ferenc Molnar’s play “Liliom”.

results.title: Caroms
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Crystal Gandrud
results.brief_description: Animation is used to exhibit the relationship between a carom an a reflection. This principle is used to solve elementary geometric inequalities, and to explore Fagano’s problem: To find a triangle of minimum perimeter that can be inscribed in a given acute-angled triangle. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Caroline Chisholm: the emigrant's friend
results.brief_description: This incredibly energetic and intelligent woman stands out as one of the few women who have been recognised throughout Australia’s history. She was called a saint in her own lifetime. Caroline Chisholm pioneered migrant welfare and helped the most disadvantaged groups of all; the women and children, the poor and uneducated, the ignorant and the persecuted. She achieved more in her lifetime than almost anyone else in our history.

results.title: Caroline Cherie = Dear Caroline
results.creator_credit: Alain Poire, Paul Cadeac and Richard Pottier
results.brief_description:
Caroline de Bievres celebrates her 16th birthday on 14 July 1789. While the Parisians storm the Bastille, Caroline experiences love with Gaston de Sallanches. Sent to Paris by her parents, she discovers that Gaston is already married.

Credits: Producer, Alain Poire, Paul Cadeac ; director, Richard Pottier ; writer, Jean Anouilh ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Georges Auric ; art director, Jacques Krauss.
Cast: Martine Carol, Jacques Dacqmine, Pierre Cressoy, Jacques Clancy, Marie Dea, Daniele Seller, Paul Bernard, Alfred Adam, Raymond Souplex, Marthe Mercadier, Nadine Alari, Yvonne de Bray, Marie Dea, Olivier Hussenot.

results.title: Caroline
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Georges Dufaux and Clement Perron
results.brief_description: To the public she is the pleasant, never-ruffled handler of everyone’s complaints at the telephone company. But behind her calm exterior the film reveals her doubts about her personal life, the domestic world of husband and child.

results.title: Caroline
results.brief_description: A story about a half caste indian girl who after her parents death, goes to live with her grandparents. But her grandfather, who was against her parents’ marriage, has difficulty in accepting Caroline as his own. However, Caroline is a courageous girl who works at gaining his acceptance and affection.

results.title: Carolin and the Frog
results.brief_description: Fact meets fantasy in the forests of East Gippsland. Carolin is a city kid; she doesn’t like the bush. Her parents are excited about their holiday in East Gippsland but to Carolin it spells dirt, insects and discomfort…until she encounters a frog! She rushes into the bush to find her voice and discovers the enchantment of the forest. Deals with the flora and fauna of East Gippsland and explores the meaning of wilderness.

results.title: Carnivorous plants
results.brief_description: Shows the unusual structure and behaviour of the Venus Flytrap, Trumpet Plant, Cobra Plant, Pitcher Plant, Sundew Plant and Utricularia, which are all species of carnivorous plants. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Carnivore capers
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development, Tony Paice and Mark Laughlin
results.brief_description: This program set in the Royal Melbourne Zoo looks at three types of carnivores - lions, cape hunting dogs and seals, and follows the keeper through a typical day.
